description: Cluster designed for tagging OSINT artifacts with relevant strategic framework information. Specifically for Block-H, these tags are related to the development and implementation of access control policy and procedures.
name: HITRUST CSF - Access Control

values.description: Access control requirements are formally established, documented and reviewed based on business and information security requirements.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.a Access Control

values.description: Users are only be provided with access to the network and network services that they have been specifically authorized to use.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.b Access to Networks and Network Services

values.description: A formal user registration and de-registration process is used to verify a user's identity and enable assignment of access rights.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.c User Registration and De-Registration

values.description: User access rights are assigned, modified and revoked as needed for all user types to all systems and services.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.d User Access Provisioning

values.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights are restricted and controlled.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.e Management of Privileged Access Rights

values.description: The allocation of secret authentication information is strictly controlled.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.f Management of Secret Authentication Information of Users

values.description: Asset owners review users’ access rights at regular intervals.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.g Review of User Access Rights

values.description: The access rights of all employees and external party users to information and information processing facilities are removed upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement, or adjusted upon change.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.h Removal or Adjustment of Access Rights

values.description: Users are required to follow the organization’s practices in the use of secret authentication information.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.i Use of Secret Authentication Information

values.description: Access to information and application system functions are restricted in accordance with the access control policy.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.j Information Access Restriction

values.description: Password management systems are interactive and ensure quality passwords.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.l Password Management System

values.description: The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls are restricted and tightly controlled.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.m Use of Privileged Utility Programs

values.description: Access to program source code is restricted.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.n Access Control to Program Source Code

values.description: User sessions are automatically terminated as needed to protect  information and information systems.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.o Session Termination

values.description: Where required by the access control policy, access to systems and applications are controlled by a secure log-on procedures.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Access Control: 05.k Secure Log-On Procedures
